comments.author: Ms_Mining
comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 09, 2023, 06:19:15 PMQuote from: elmo40 on November 09, 2023, 06:11:23 PMPre-sales for a mined coin?Doesn't pass the smell test...If you are willing to donate the required amount a project needs for CoinMarketCap/CoinGecko listings, exchange listings, nodes etc. then i can cancel the presale right away.It would be better to ask and learn before you judge anything. We are not in 2009. We are in 2023 and a lot of things have changed since then.Yes, a lot has changed now. Among all projects, 70% offer to buy their unnecessary shitcoins, 20% are aimed at a few days of existence for a pump&sale cycle, 9% slip malware into their wallets. Don't be surprised by the lack of confidence in your project.@miningrelease

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 09, 2023, 06:19:15 PMQuote from: elmo40 on November 09, 2023, 06:11:23 PMPre-sales for a mined coin?Doesn't pass the smell test...If you are willing to donate the required amount a project needs for CoinMarketCap/CoinGecko listings, exchange listings, nodes etc. then i can cancel the presale right away.To get started, start by listing on CoinGecko. This procedure is free of charge there. This will be at least a plus for your project. And when you have complete information about your coin there, you can post a link to your coin on CoinGecko.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 10, 2023, 02:20:05 PMCoinMarketCap and CoinGecko listings are not free. Nothing is free in our days. Everyone asks for money and they are very expensive.Have you tried contacting them and applying? Because their website says their listing is free and no one at CoinGecko will ever ask for a listing fee. Quote from: https://www.coingecko.com/en/methodologyGetting your token or exchange listed on CoinGecko is free and no CoinGecko representative will ever ask you for any form of listing fees.I just wouldn't say that. So, you should try contacting them first.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 10, 2023, 07:27:35 PMQuote from: Xal0lex on November 10, 2023, 04:46:15 PMQuote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 10, 2023, 02:20:05 PMCoinMarketCap and CoinGecko listings are not free. Nothing is free in our days. Everyone asks for money and they are very expensive.Have you tried contacting them and applying? Because their website says their listing is free and no one at CoinGecko will ever ask for a listing fee. Quote from: https://www.coingecko.com/en/methodologyGetting your token or exchange listed on CoinGecko is free and no CoinGecko representative will ever ask you for any form of listing fees.I just wouldn't say that. So, you should try contacting them first.Just for your information, I’m not new in cryptos. I work in cryptos since 2012 and I have participated in many projects. As project manager, marketing manager, project owner etc. Listings are not free. Yes they claim in their websites that listings are free but this is not true. They don’t list you if you don’t find an unofficial listed to pay him and list your coin/token. Maybe they can list a project for free if it has really big liquidity and volume. The last weeks, CMC has changed their listing terms and now they write that listings cost $5,000!You didn't answer my question. Did you try to apply and was rejected? Or did they require you to pay a fee to list your coin with them? It doesn't say anything on their website about requiring large liquidity and volume in an asset. About CMC, I know that.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 09, 2023, 04:33:38 PM...After 13 years of anonymity and disappearance, Satoshi Nakamoto is back!...I'm sure you're not who you say you are. And this statement alone is enough to consider you a fraudster who not only pretends to be Satoshi Nakamoto, but also uses the name Satoshi to name his token. And since you're impersonating Satoshi Nakamoto, then you don't need to create a new account, use your old one - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile ;u=3

comments.author: tvplus006

comments.body: Quote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 24, 2023, 02:44:12 PMQuote from: tvplus006 on November 24, 2023, 01:44:31 PMQuote from: SATcoinScrypt on November 09, 2023, 04:33:38 PM...After 13 years of anonymity and disappearance, Satoshi Nakamoto is back!...I'm sure you're not who you say you are. And this statement alone is enough to consider you a fraudster who not only pretends to be Satoshi Nakamoto, but also uses the name Satoshi to name his token. And since you're impersonating Satoshi Nakamoto, then you don't need to create a new account, use your old one - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile ;u=3...Where exactly is the fraud? You are very funny, really. I'm laughing.I understand that you are a crook who uses the legendary name Satoshi Nakamoto to promote your coin. But for a beginner who is not yet familiar with the history of the creation of Bitcoin, such statements can be misleading and he may really think that this shit coin is really the brainchild of Satoshi Nakamoto, especially since the name of the coin confirms this.https://web.archive.org/web/20231124205113/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5473519.0
